abstract.p: AT&T Corp splits off its wireless unit, AT&T Wireless Group, into separate, independent company (S)

block.p: AT&T split off its wireless unit, the AT&T Wireless Group, into a separate, independent company yesterday, marking a major step in the telephone and cable company's restructuring.

AT&T said it was converting all AT&T Wireless tracking stock into AT&T Wireless common stock and distributing 1.14 billion shares of AT&T Wireless common stock, currently held by AT&T, to AT&T's common stockholders of record on June 22.
AT&T split off its wireless unit, the AT&T Wireless Group, into a separate, independent company yesterday, marking a major step in the telephone and cable company's restructuring.

AT&T said it was converting all AT&T Wireless tracking stock into AT&T Wireless common stock and distributing 1.14 billion shares of AT&T Wireless common stock, currently held by AT&T, to AT&T's common stockholders of record on June 22.

AT&T stockholders will receive 0.3218 share for each AT&T common share they hold, with a cash payment for any fractional shares. AT&T Wireless tracking stock is being exchanged for AT&T Wireless common stock one for one.
